arts.ttl: Roma director Ghisolfi critical of refereeing in draw with Monza: “What happened is unacceptable.”
arts.sum: Roma’s Technical Director Florent Ghisolfi expressed strong dissatisfaction with the officiating following the team’s draw against Monza. Speaking to Sky Sport after the match, Ghisolfi voiced the club’s perspective on what they perceived as subpar refereeing, particularly regarding a potential penalty incident involving Baldanzi. “I don’t usually come to talk about refereeing, but what happened today is unacceptable,” Ghisolfi stated firmly. He emphasized that the incident with Baldanzi appeared to be a clear penalty to most observers. While acknowledging that the referee was at some distance from the play, Ghisolfi questioned why VAR did not intervene in the situation. arts.ttl: Roma manager Ivan Juric sees potential despite draw with Monza
arts.sum: Roma’s pursuit of the top spots in Serie A hit a snag as they were held to a 1-1 draw by Monza. Despite the setback, manager Ivan Juric remained optimistic about his team’s performance and future prospects. Juric praised his team’s overall display, stating, “My Roma played a great game. We controlled the match and created numerous scoring opportunities.” He emphasized the need for improved finishing, noting that the team conceded very little defensively. The manager expressed his admiration for the team’s performance, saying, “I saw a beautiful Roma. arts.ttl: Serie A | Monza 1-1 Roma: Match Report
arts.sum: In a match marked by injury concerns for both sides, Roma and Monza played out a 1-1 draw in Serie A. The result leaves Roma still adjusting to life under new coach Ivan Juric, while Monza continues to navigate through a significant injury crisis. Roma, missing key players like Paulo Dybala and Mats Hummels, dominated possession early but struggled to break through. Their first goal was disallowed when Artem Dovbyk was found offside after pouncing on a rebound from Manu Koné’s shot that hit the post.
